results.title: Black Narcissus
results.creator_credit: GFD, Archers Film Productions, Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger
results.brief_description: Obstacles in the life of a nun’s community high in the Himalayas range from a cynical British agent, suspicious natives, longings of the flesh, problems of faith and insanity to the arduous surrounding terrain. The mission prospers, but often at the expense of spiritual progress and although the nuns eventually retreat from the mission and the threatening terrain it is with a sense of having achieved some small spiritual gains. “One of the few genuinely erotic films to emerge from these sexually staid isles” said one critic. The glorious Oscar winning photography was a trick because it was shot in a London studio and backyard garden. The title refers to the intoxicating perfume worn by Indian Prince Sabu in his last major role. Based on the novel by Rumer Godden. Stars Deborah Kerr, David Farrar, Sabu, Jean Simmons, Flora Robson and Esmond Knight.

results.title: Black music in America: the 70's
results.creator_credit: BMA and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An overview of the world of black music in the 1970’s. Presents a musical journey from Motown to disco of Donna Summer. Includes clips of over seventy-five groups showing the growth and influence of black music in this decade. Narrators are Isaac Hayes and Dionne Warwick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Black music in America: from then till now
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Richard Kerns, William H. Barnett and Hugh A Robertson
results.brief_description: Presents the history of black people’s contribution to American music from the pioneer days until 1970. Features among others; Louis Armstrong, Mahalia Jackson, Duke Ellington, Count Bassie, Nina Simone and what is reported to be the only footage of Bessie Smith.
results.title_for_label: Black music in America: from then till now

results.title: Black man down
results.creator_credit: Bill McCrow, Bruce Redman and Sam Watson
results.brief_description: ‘Black man down’ is a perilous journey into the Aboriginal psyche. It is a journey to the roots of time that expands and pulses with dark, mysterious energies. A young warrior, alone in a prison cell, is plagued and confronted by the ghosts of his past and spirits of the land. Death calls to him with a silken tongue, the sprits urge him to live….

results.title: Black man's houses (A)
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, Steve Thomas, Australian Film Commission and John Moore
results.brief_description: More than a hundred years after the Tasmanian Aborigines were declared extinct, their descendants set out to reclaim the lost graves of their ancestors on Flinders Island in Bass Strait. The neglected burial site at Wybalenna was, in the 1830’s, Australia’s first segregated Reserve, under the directorship of George Augustus Robinson and is now the battleground which divides a community. The film raises difficult questions about what constitutes Aboriginality today, and how colonial attitudes still linger on. Winner Best Australian Film at the Melbourne Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Open Channel Productions, Steve Thomas, Australian Film Commission and John Moore

results.title: Black Magic (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is a film about sport and top Aboriginal sportsmen. It is predominantly an account of the creative use of sport made by the Noongar people of Western Australia’s south-west to advance their status. Through interviews with top sportsmen like the Krakouer brothers in the Victorian Football League and Archie Jones, the runner of the 1920s, the film establishes that the motivation to succeed in sport arises from a moral desire to be accepted and recognised.

results.title: Black Island
results.creator_credit: Children's Film Foundation, Carole K. Smith and Ben Bolt
results.brief_description: A children’s adventure film about two young boys, Michael and Joe, who find themselves stranded on a remote island with a couple of escaped convicts. Cast includes Martin Murphy, Mikael Salomon, Michael Elphick, Frank Leigh, Allan Surtees, Norman Tipton.

results.title: Black ice
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Springbett, Don Hopkins and Peter Shatalow
results.brief_description: Black Ice is a short film about a group of sailing enthusiasts who have adapted the principles of the sport to winter conditions. The sight of a fragile craft whisking across a frozen lake at one hundred kilometres per hour, leaving a shower of powdered ice in its wake, is breathtaking. Iceboat racing is exciting; a sport like no other in the world. Awards: Chicago, Budapest, Cortina d’Ampezzo.

results.title: Black hearted Barney Blackfoot
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description: The story of Billy and Lucy’s mean stepfather who is helped in his evil exploits by his friend the moving wardrobe. A humorous moral tale using sound effects with no commentary.
